channel.title: Now what?
channel.description:
Ok, I change the Null like Dell said, compile and get this:
antilag.java:4: error while writing antilag: antilag.class (Access is denied) public class antilag

item.title: Now what?
item.dc:creator: @cccrrraaazzziii cccrrraaazzziii
item.description:
@cccrrraaazzziii wrote:

Wow… It’s amazing what you can learn. It’s ok guys, I had my files hidden, and I put them to normal, and yes “hey presto”, it worked.

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Now what?
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

You dont add the stuff to your antilag.class, you add it to your client.java, but if you did add it into your client java, follow up below…

open up your antilag.java file, and replace everything in there with this…

[code]// This resets server every 30 mins to stop lag - xerozcheez
import java.io.*;

public class antilag
{

public int ResetTimer = 0;

public void resetserver()
{
misc.println(“RESETING SERVER!!!”);
misc.println(“Saving all games…”);
PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
misc.println(“GAME SUCCESSFULLY SAVED FOR ALL PLAYERS”);
ResetTimer = 0;
closeListener();
runserver();
}
public void process()
{
ResetTimer += 1;
if(ResetTimer >= 999999)
{
resetserver();
}
}

public void runserver()
{
try
{
String run = “runserver.bat”;
String xstr = “./”+run;
Runtime.getRuntime().exec(xstr);
}
catch (IOException ioe)
{
ioe.printStackTrace();
}
}

public void closeListener()
{
try {
server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
if(server.clientListener != null) server.clientListener.close();
server.clientListener = null;
}
catch(java.lang.Exception __ex)
{
__ex.printStackTrace();
}
}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Now what?
item.dc:creator: @Slivion Slivion
item.description:
@Slivion wrote:

Your compiler cannot find the file, antilag.class.
It’s either not there, hidden or locked.
You could get one, if you ask nicely on the forum.

Read full topic
